this

3.4.20  1:42 am   3.3.20  3:30 am hey bill, thanks for answering.see i'm in my second year of college, and obviously that's not a place where you want to be lazy, but i have managed to just slip by in grades with some luck and the help of classmates. the point is; i always end up doing things at the last moment, were it be studying for a test or doing homework, i always do them at the last day, at the last hour, but somehow, i have managed to survive, just survive. and now the thing is i don't want to keep doing that, i don't want to be so lazy.

      i have lots of free days and spare time and i know i should use that free time studying or doing my homework, but i just don't want to do either of them, because doing something i don't want to just makes me feel awful, almost miserable, like i'm being forced into doing something i hate.

     but at the same time i know i should not feel that way and i should be more responsible .

      sorry for the long answer, but short answer to your question, what i want to do if i weren't so lazy is study and do my homework in my free time instead of doing nothing.

3.2.20  11:30 am   2.29.20  9:26 am
Yes, I can clearly tell if I hit the right ones (like when I learn a song, I know what the 'right' notes are, I can tell without doubt if I'm doing it right, but have completely know sense of the interval relationships between them) after I like try every note around the previous one...and this persists even to now...
I know I'm far ahead on paper and I know I need my ears to catch up, but i really have little idea how I could achieve this.

     (the same thing happens when I try to learn a foreign language. I can read competently in my target language but with toddler level's understanding of audio messages. so it really blows my mind when I heard someone who learnt foreign languages primarily by listening or there are some amazing creatures called illiterate who can speak a language fluently without understanding its orthography). I've been clueless for really long time, and wh en I sea rch online I can only see people who got a great ear but have problem reading staff or sth, none of them in the opposite situation. The things I think I can do now is just doing some mechanical ear training exercise i.e. recognize intervals, chords in isolation one by one, or listening for the melody/chords of songs (mentioned in the previous question) in a fruitless and excruciatingly slow way and wonder along whether I practice the right way... any advice on what I should do? (train in alternative ways or do the same thing with some change)

Has the entrapment of woman via marriage which Blake called a "gilded cage" merely deteriorated to the "rusty prison" of the Bang Bus, representative of the anonymous male-centric sex and continued subjugation?

1.14.20  4:14 pm   1.12.20  11:37 pm How will we know which ones are the new ones?

1.14.20  1:48 pm   1.10.20  5:29 am   it feels that way but that doesn't necessarily make it true..does an amoeba have free will? does a person with a tumor pressing on their brain causing them to have uncontrollable violent impulses have free will? i think we feel like we are in control because it's evolutionarily advantageous for us to feel that way, but really we are reactionary in nature. think of any movie right now...did you decide which movie to think of or did one just pop in your mind?

     i would argue everything is like that, including our deepest desires and values, that doesn't make our actions less valuable or important, it just means that ultimately, we as individuals are not the authors of our thoughts and actions, more like witnesses of them.

1.11.20  5:20 am   1.7.20  9:47 pm hi I'm an agronomist and my boyfriend is a plant physiologist, when roots are connected plants can communicate with extremely slow electrical impulses. If roots aren't connected, some fungi can transfer the signal. The closer relative the other plant is, the clearer the communication. These messages are usually about the environment and slowly advancing dangers. Quickly advancing dangers (animals eating plants) use hormones and wind. Since these responses are to dangers, plants "feel", but as far as we know, not emotions.

We have the questions page bookmarked on our homescreens, we like to explore your really awesome project of a website together:) we know it isn't a question, but it's 3:20AM and we couldn't help but chime in:)

1.10.20  5:29 am   1.8.20  1:59 am

To play devil's advocate, yes QM implies the universe is not deterministic, but the prevailing interpretation of QM is that the non-determinism is all randomness and probability. So for free will you would need a way for all conscious decision maker beings (arguably all complex life) to control randomness and probability itself

1.10.20  5:10 am   1.9.20  8:27 am
